intro: Ribes takare var. desmocarpum, commonly known as the Alaska currant, is a shrub native to the northwestern United States and southern Canada. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant features small, five-petaled flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by edible berries that are dark red to black in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, contributing to its ornamental value. The shrub is typically hardy in USDA zones 3 to 7 and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
